sentences.text: PROPOSAL #3 - RE-APPROVAL OF THE FASTENAL COMPANY INCENTIVE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our shareholders to re-approve the Fastenal Company Incentive Plan pursuant to which cash incentive awards are made to eligible employees of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because five years have passed since the last approval by our shareholders of the incentive plan, Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code requires us to obtain shareholder re-approval of the material terms of the plan in order to preserve our ability to deduct, for federal income tax purposes, performance-based incentive compensation paid to certain of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally seek to preserve our ability to claim tax deductions for compensation paid to executives to the greatest extent practicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code generally does not allow a publicly held company to obtain a tax deduction for compensation of more than $1,000,000 paid in any fiscal year to certain 'covered employees' unless such compensation is considered 'performance-based' in accordance with Section 162(m) and its implementing regulations published by the Treasury Department.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Section 162(m) as currently interpreted by the Internal Revenue Service, the group of 'covered employees' as of the end of any taxable year consists of a company's chief executive officer and its three other most highly compensated executive officers, other than the chief financial officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash bonuses and incentive payments will qualify as performance-based compensation if:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They are payable solely on account of the attainment of one or more objective performance goa
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The material terms under which the bonuses are to be paid, including the nature of the performance goals or the formula used to calculate the bonus amounts, are approved by the shareholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee certifies that the performance goals and other material terms have been satisfied before the bonuses are paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation committee is comprised solely of outside directors and therefore satisfies the requirements of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our incentive plan was structured in a manner intended to comply with the requirements of Section 162(m) and was last approved by our shareholders in April 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full text of our incentive plan is attached to this proxy statement as Appendix A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of Incentive Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The more significant features of our incentive plan are described below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation committee, all of whose members are outside directors, administers the incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee has the authority to grant cash awards upon such terms, not inconsistent with the terms of the incentive plan, as it considers appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the compensation committee has complete authority to interpret all provisions of the incentive plan, to adopt, amend, and rescind rules and regulations pertaining to the administration of the incentive plan, and to make all other determinations necessary or advisable for the administration of the incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our employees, who currently number approximately 20,000, are eligible to participate in the incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation committee determines which employees will be participants in the incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation committee has to date limited participation to our executive officers, and expects that it will continue to limit participation in the same manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the criteria the compensation committee applies to determine who may participate may change in future years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other annual or short-term bonus arrangements may be made available to employees who are not executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Measures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants will receive awards under the incentive plan whose payout will be contingent upon the degree of attainment over the applicable performance period of one or more performance goals based on performance measures specified in the incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the start of each performance period the compensation committee will select the applicable performance measure(s), specify the performance goals(s) based on those performance measures, and specify, in terms of an objective formula or standard, the method for calculating the amount payable to a participant if the performance goals(s) are satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance measures to be utilized in connection with any plan award intended to qualify as performance-based compensation for purposes of Section 162(m) are to be one or any combination of two or more of the following metrics:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net sales;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net earnings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings before one or more of interest, income taxes, depreciation, amortization, or other adjustments;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings per share (basic or diluted);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Profitability as measured by return ratios (including return on assets, return on equity, return on investment, and return on net sales) or the degree to which any of the foregoing earnings measures exceeds a percentage of net sales;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Margins (including one or more of gross, operating, and net earnings margins);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock price;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total shareholder return;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any performance measure utilized may be expressed in absolute amounts, on a per share basis, as a growth rate or change from preceding periods, as a comparison to the performance of specified companies or other external indices or measures, or as a percentage of any of the criteria, and may relate to Fastenal-wide, unit, division, affiliate or individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Periods
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A performance period is the measure of time specified by our compensation committee over which the degree of attainment of the specified performance measures will be measured.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A performance period must be at least one fiscal quarter in duration for awards involving 'covered officers', defined in the incentive plan as participants who are, or are designated by the compensation committee as persons who may potentially be, 'covered employees' for purposes of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee expects to continue our current practice of using quarterly performance periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All awards under the incentive plan for a performance period will be paid in cash following the end of such performance period and our compensation committee's certification of the degree to which applicable performance goals based on performance measures selected for the performance period were attained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee may reduce, in its discretion, the amount of any award otherwise payable under the incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum individual award payment that can be made under the incentive plan may not exceed the greater of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) $1,000,000 for a quarterly performance period (or the corresponding multiple of that amount for any performance period that is more than one quarter in duration), or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) 4.5% of the amount by which our company's earnings before income taxes for the applicable performance period exceed 105% of our company's earnings before income taxes for the comparable fiscal period in the immediately preceding calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this calculation, our company's earnings before income taxes for any period shall be such amount as is reported (or to be reported) for that period in the company's periodic reports filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination of Employment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ordinarily, no award for a performance period will be paid to a participant who is not actively employed by us at the end of the applicable performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a participant's employment ends during a performance period, our compensation committee does, however, have the discretion to approve payment to the participant, or his or her beneficiaries, of a pro rata portion of the award payment the participant would have received but for the fact that the participant's employment ended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Recovery Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that any compensation associated with an award under the incentive plan is considered 'incentive-based compensation' within the meaning and subject to the requirements of Section 10D of the Exchange Act, such compensation will be subject to potential forfeiture to or recovery by us in accordance with any compensation recovery policy we adopt in the future in response to new requirements of Section 10D of the Exchange Act and any related implementing rules and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amendment and Termination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation committee or board of directors may amend, suspend or terminate the incentive plan from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An amendment will be subject to the approval of our shareholders only if such approval is necessary to maintain the incentive plan in compliance with Section 162(m) or other applicable laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Federal Income Tax Consequences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All cash award payments made under the incentive plan are taxable to the participant when made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incentive plan is intended to comply with Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goal in this regard is to enable us to make award payments under the incentive plan to participants who are or may be 'covered employees' for purposes of Section 162(m) that can qualify as performance-based compensation and enable us to claim a federal income tax deduction for the full amount of any such award payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Future Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Future payments under the incentive plan for 2017 will be based on actual performance during quarters that are not yet completed and awards under the incentive plan for years after 2017 are discretionary with the compensation committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, amounts payable or allocable under the incentive plan in the future to any particular individual or group of individuals are not currently determinable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS VOTING FOR THE RE-APPROVAL OF THE FASTENAL COMPANY INCENTIVE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL #4  AN ADVISORY VOTE ON A NON-BINDING RESOLUTION TO APPROVE THE COMPENSATION OF OU NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS DISCLOSED IN THIS PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation committee has described our compensation philosophy in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis contained in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are urged to read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis which also discusses how our compensation programs implement our compensation philosophy, as well as the Summary Compensation Table and other related tables and narrative disclosure which describe the compensation of all individuals who served as our chief executive officer or our chief financial officer during any part of 2016 and the other three most highly compensated executive officers of Fastenal in 2016 who were serving as executive officers at the end of 2016 (our 'named executive officers') set forth under 'Executive Compensation' below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee and the board of directors believe the policies and procedures articulated in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis are effective in implementing our compensation philosophy and in achieving our compensation goals and that the compensation of our executive officers in 2016 reflects and supports these compensation policies and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required pursuant to Section 14A of the Exchange Act, shareholders are being asked to vote on the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, the shareholders of Fastenal Company approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the company's named executive officers, as disclosed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, compensation tables, and related disclosures contained in the section of the proxy statement for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders captioned 'Executive Compensation'.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory vote on executive compensation, commonly referred to as a 'say-on-pay' advisory vote, is not binding on our board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the board and compensation committee will take into account the results of the vote when determining future executive compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS VOTING FOR ADOPTION OF THE RESOLUTION APPROVING THE COMPENSATION OF OUR NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL #5  AN ADVISORY, NON-BINDING VOTE TO DETERMINE THE FREQUENCY (WHETHER ANNUAL, BIENNIAL, OR TRIENNIAL) WITH WHICH SHAREHOLDERS OF THE COMPANY SHALL BE ENTITLED TO HAVE AN ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are providing shareholders an advisory vote on the frequency with which our shareholders shall have the advisory 'say-on-pay' vote on executive compensation as provided for in Proposal #4 above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is required under Section 14A of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisory vote on the frequency of the 'say-on-pay' vote is a non-binding vote as to how often the 'say-on-pay' vote should occur: every year, every two years, or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, shareholders may abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are required to hold the advisory vote on the frequency of the 'say-on-pay' vote at least once every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors concluded that an annual advisory vote to obtain shareholder feedback is appropriate for our organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we conclude over the next several years that this annual vote is not a useful tool for the maintenance of our simple compensation structure that rewards both short-term execution and long-term strategy, we will so advise our shareholders and reduce the frequency as so allowed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this approach is consistent with the type of open and transparent dialogue we have had with our shareholders since first going public in 1987.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are being asked to vote on a resolution to determine, on an advisory basis, whether the frequency with which the shareholders shall have an advisory vote on executive compensation set forth in the company's proxy statement for its annual meeting of shareholders, beginning with the 2017 annual meeting of shareholders, should be
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) every year,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) every two years, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The choice of frequency which receives the highest number of votes will be deemed the choice of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this advisory vote on the frequency of the 'say-on-pay' vote is not binding on our board of directors, the board and compensation committee will take into account the result of the vote when determining the frequency of future 'say-on-pay' votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis provides information about the fiscal 2016 compensation programs for our named executive officers, who, in 2016, were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Daniel L. Florness, President and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Terry M. Owen, Senior Executive Vice President - Sales Operations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe compensation programs are most effective when they are fair, simple, transparent, designed to motivate employees to take prudent entrepreneurial risk to achieve company goals, and paid as close to the time the goals are achieved as is possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our primary objective is to structure compensation so as to ensure that a significant portion is directly tied to achievement of financial and operational goals and other factors that impact shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with this philosophy, our compensation program for executive officers incorporates features such as the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual base salaries are generally below the market median;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Quarterly cash incentive opportunities based on growth in pre-tax or net earnings are typically above the market median;  Long-term incentives are provided annually in the form of stock options with extended (generally five to eight year) vesting periods, and are not limited to senior executives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vesting of stock option awards is accelerated in connection with a change in control only if the awards are neither assumed nor replaced by the surviving entity in the change in control transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement and health and welfare plans in which executive officers participate are the same as those generally available to all U.S. employees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No perquisites are provided; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries for our named executive officers for 2016 were generally unchanged from 2015, except for adjustments due to changes in an officer's position and increases primarily reflective of an officer's enhanced level of responsibility within the company, and except for Mr. Lewis, who joined the company on August 16, 2016, and Ms. Lisowski, whose base salary was raised to bring it closer in line with other executive officers who have comparable levels of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Quarterly cash incentive programs for our named executive officers were restructured in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014, if pre-tax or net earnings for any quarter exceeded 105% of pre-tax or net earnings for the same quarter in the previous year, we paid our named executive officers cash bonuses for that quarter equal to a specified percentage of the excess amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our method of determining cash incentives for our named executive officers in 2015 continued to reward earnings growth, the minimum target was reduced from 105% to 100% and the payout percentages were also adjusted to partially offset the change in the minimum target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The structure of the quarterly cash incentive programs for our named executive officers for 2016 was substantially the same as the structure in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash incentive plan payouts to our named executive officers for 2016 (excluding Mr. Lewis, who was not an employee in 2015) were approximately 74% less than the payouts for 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below sets out certain financial information for the company for each of the past three years and includes our actual annual pre-tax earnings and net earnings on a company-wide basis and an annualized calculation of our minimum target pre-tax earnings and net earnings on a company-wide basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, bonuses for our executive officers are determined and paid out on a quarterly basis; however, we felt an annualized depiction would more clearly illustrate the philosophy underlying the bonus component of our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Pre-tax and net earnings targets were calculated as 100% of the prior year's actual pre-tax or net earnings for 2016 and 2015, and as 105% of the prior year's actual pre-tax or net earnings for 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock option grants were made in 2016 to all of our named executive officers (other than Mr. Lewis, who joined the company later in the year) consistent with a change in practice in 2015 pursuant to which most of our employees with option awards are now receiving yearly grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In deciding to continue our existing executive compensation practices in 2016 in a manner largely consistent with 2015, our compensation committee took into account the fact that the holders of over 93% of the shares voted at our 2016 annual meeting of shareholders approved, on an advisory basis, the compensation of our named executive officers in 2015 as disclosed in the proxy statement for the 2016 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mitigation of Compensation-Related Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company's management, in concert with the compensation committee, has examined the company's compensation policies, plans, and practices to determine if they create incentives or encourage behavior that is reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conducting this examination, management and the compensation committee have reviewed the company's compensation plans and programs, including incentive bonus and equity award plans, and evaluated the impact of such plans and programs in terms of business risk and the mitigating controls in place to manage those risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such controls include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regular scrutiny of performance and compliance with policies and procedures by senior executive managers responsible for specific business areas;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ongoing monitoring of specific asset areas by regional finance managers, and by internal audit and finance department personnel;  The design of our executive cash incentive arrangements, which
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) by focusing on quarterly growth in profits, provides executives with the immediate feedback necessary to take prompt action to correct unacceptable financial results and the motivation to take such action, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) by using actual profits in current periods, rather than projected profits, as the bases for setting the minimum performance targets in future periods, reduces the incentive to manipulate results, as any overstated profits, giving rise to increased bonuses, in one year would result in overstated minimum targets, giving rise to reduced bonuses, in the next year; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Longer than typical vesting periods for equity-based compensation that encourage long-term perspe
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of the controls in place, we have concluded that there are no unmitigated risks created by the company's compensation policies, plans and practices that create incentives or encourage behavior that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Underlying Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Companies succeed to the extent that all persons in the organization pursue a common goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fastenal's goal is simple - Growth through Customer Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We keep everyone focused on this common goal by treating everyone fairly and equitably.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe all of our people are 'key people' in the achievement of our success and that belief is reflected in our compensation system.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By striving for fair and equitable treatment for all employees, everyone can stay focused on the common goal of growing our business by serving the customer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equitable treatment does not mean equal compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation will be fair, but not the same for everyone, if it is based on an employee's knowledge and responsibilities, the difficulty of the task being performed by the employee, and the leadership requirements of he employee's position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The reward system must be designed to keep everyone focused on our common goal, yet developed in such a manner so as to mitigate unnecessary risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With this in mind, our compensation program is designed to be simple, understandable, and ransparent to all.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are a decentralized company with decisions made by those closest to our customer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We avoid central planning as we believe it stifles the creativity of our people and because it is, quite frankly, too slow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To mitigate and control risk, we teach our employees to make decisions within the framework of the company goal - Growth through Customer Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This structure has been developed from the ground up, not top down, and it continues to change as needed to meet customer needs, hence focusing on 'growing the business'.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To best achieve success, we expect and encourage our people to take entrepreneurial risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: People are hired because of their entrepreneurial attitudes and we encourage and reward this important mindset.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We think of our business as being approximately 2,500 highly orchestrated local businesses working in concert.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our organization is structured to serve our customers and achieve Growth through Customer Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The highly motivated entrepreneurs running each of our stores make the daily decisions needed to serve our customers and to make themselves and the company successful, and those decisions directly impact the compensation of the individuals who make them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation system fosters entrepreneurship and progress toward our common goal of profitable growth by making the growth of our sales or profits a key element of the payment formula for most bonuses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The feeling of ownership, propelled by our compensation programs, is an important characteristic that drives our success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our people are motivated by the knowledge that if they work hard and demonstrate their creativity and contribute to our success, the opportunities are significant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive compensation, quickly paid, is an important part of the reward structure in our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Simplicity, Transparency, and Immediacy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that compensation programs are most effective if they are simple, concise, and openly communicated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that regard, we do not have an elaborate compensation system with many different components, and the few elements of our compensation system are simple and easy for our employees - the people we need to motivate to achieve our success - and our shareholders to understand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that a more complex compensation system would risk distracting our employees from the common goal of profitably growing our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we have systems in place that let our employees know, on a daily basis, how their stores are performing compared to other stores in our organization and how that performance impacts their compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay cash bonuses as close as we can to the time when the work is performed and results are achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, we pay bonuses for performance achievement on a monthly or quarterly basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We don't wait until the end of the year, or several years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that quick payment of cash bonuses serves to motivate our people and control business risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our line of business, undue risk manifests itself quickly in unacceptable financial results, and our compensation system is designed to ensure that unacceptable financial results are immediately reflected in our peoples' compensation so as to provide them with the feedback and motivation necessary to take prompt corrective action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our entrepreneurial environment, where actions are rewarded and penalized, means our people immediately feel the effects of their decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Program Goals and Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goals and objectives in designing our compensation programs for all employees, including our executive officers, are to have programs that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align the interests of our employees with those of our shareholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Are simple, understandable, and transparent;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Are reasonable, fair and equitable, to both the employees and shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reflect compensation differences based on position and responsibility, providing more variable and contingent compensation to those with greater responsibilities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay bonuses quickly; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieve overall compensation levels that are sufficiently competitive to retain, attract, and motivate all employees, and reflect their responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs are designed to reward:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achievement of stated goals, targets, and superior results necessary to profitably grow our business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A focus on Growth through Customer Service;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An entrepreneurial mindset;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal growth and assumption of additional responsibilities; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prudent management of business risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not use the services of outside consultants to establish or monitor our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Employees are Compensated
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 75% of our employees interface directly with customers on a daily basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goal with respect to compensation of these employees is simple; a significant portion of their pay should be based on how well they have grown their piece of the business and served our customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Typical pay arrangements provide a base amount paid periodically during the month, along with a major opportunity to earn bonus amounts, paid monthly, based on growth in sales, gross profit achieved, the opening of new accounts, increase in sales to active accounts, prudent management of inventory levels, and collections of accounts receivable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our combination and mix of base and bonus pay motivates our people to high levels of individual and company success, as the goals and objectives have been repeatedly demonstrated to be achievable with superior effort.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of the remaining approximately 25% of our employees, many are similarly compensated for their contribution to attaining predetermined departmental or project and cost containment goals, most focused on either customer service or better execution of company-wide activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In these cases, the incentives are paid as soon as possible upon attainment of the goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Again, the goals and objectives are clearly communicated and the resources for success are provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because we believe the growth in the company's stock value should be the reward for achieving long-term success consistent with being an owner, we have a stock option plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since certain of our foreign employees are unable to receive stock options due to legal restrictions, we also have a stock appreciation rights plan for those foreign employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock appreciation rights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: granted under that plan are settled in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our employees are eligible to receive stock option grants or stock appreciation rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our combination of short and long-term rewards and incentives has proven successful as reflected in our historic performance and acceptable levels of employee retention and turnover.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management's Role in Setting Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management plays an important role in our executive compensation setting process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The most significant aspects of management's role are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Evaluating employee performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommending business performance targets and objectives; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommending salary levels and option awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the ultimate decisions regarding executive compensation are made by the compensation committee, our chief executive officer worked with our compensation committee in 2016 in establishing the agenda and discussion surrounding executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During this process, the chief executive officer was asked to provide:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His evaluation of the performance of our other executive officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation recommendations as to other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting the compensation level for our chief executive officer for 2016, the compensation committee asked for and received input from that individual about what was reasonable and fair, yet challenging, in terms of setting performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We respect our chief executive officer's knowledge of our business and industry; however, the final determination as to the compensation of our chief executive officer was made by the compensation committee after careful consideration of numerous factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have no employment, severance, or change in control agreements with any of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock option plan provides that if the company is not the surviving or acquiring corporation in the event of a merger or similar transaction, then the vesting and exercisability of outstanding stock options will be accelerated only if the surviving or acquiring corporation does not assume or replace the outstanding options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vesting and exercisability of outstanding options will also be accelerated in the event of a dissolution or liquidation of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change in control provisions in our stock option plan are designed to ensure maximum flexibility for the company in the event of a merger or similar transaction, in that we can provide for the continuation of options if that is more attractive to potential acquiring companies or can provide for acceleration of vesting of options if we believe doing so would facilitate retention of critical employees during acquisition discussions, would better motivate management to obtain the highest price possible by aligning their interests more closely with those of our shareholders, or would otherwise benefit our shareholders and be fair to our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elements of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program has historically been comprised of four elements: base salary, quarterly incentives, equity-based long- term incentives, and other compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While all elements of our executive compensation program are intended to collectively achieve our overriding purpose of attracting, retaining, and motivating talented executives, the table below identifies the form and additional specific purposes of each element.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Component   Form of Compensation   Purpose Base Salary   Cash  Compensate each named executive officer relative to individual responsibilities, experience, and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide regular cash flow not contingent on short-term variations in company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Quarterly Incentives   Cash  Align compensation with our quarterly corporate financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward achievement of short-term profit growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide executives with a meaningful total cash compensation opportunity (base salary + quarterly bonuses).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term Incentives   Stock Options  Encourage long-term retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Create a long-term performance focus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align compensation with our long-term returns to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide executive ownership opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation   Benefits  Provide competitive retirement and health and welfare benefit plans generally available to all of our employees, including executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The philosophy and make-up of the program for compensating executives is similar to the philosophy and make-up of the programs for all other employees, in that our executive incentive compensation programs are simple and transparent, and cash incentives earned by our executive officers are paid as close as possible to when the work is done.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have a specific policy for allocating compensation between short- and long-term components, or between cash and non-cash components.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We utilize pay practices which we believe are fair and commensurate with the particular employee's level of responsibility and results achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the aforementioned components provide a reasonable total compensation package for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of our desire to emphasize those elements of compensation that are performance based, our practice has generally been to set base salary levels below the market median for each executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting these salary levels for individual executives, we consider past performance, expected performance, experience of the individual executive, historical compensation levels, and competitive pay practices at he peer group of companies identified under 'Market Competitiveness Review' below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also consider industry conditions and the overall effectiveness of our compensation program in achieving desired performance levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of our 'pay for performance' mentality, this is he only material component of executive compensation that is not tied directly to our performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation committee established the base salary to be paid to each of our named executive officers for 2016 at its last meeting in 2015, except that Mr. Florness' base salary for 2016 was determined on October 12, 2015 upon his appointment as president and chief executive officer of the company effective January 1, 2016, Mr. Lewis' base salary for 2016 was determined on August 4, 2016 upon his appointment as executive vice president and chief financial officer of the company effective August 16, 2016, and Mr. Watts' base salary for 2016 was determined by his direct supervisor prior to being named as an executive officer effective December 20, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In his new role as president and chief executive officer, Mr. Florness was paid a base salary in 2016 of $550,000, which was the same as the annual base salary paid to our prior president and chief executive officer in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In his role as executive vice president and chief financial officer, Mr. Lewis was paid a base salary in 2016 of $320,000 (prorated based on the number of days during 2016 in which he served in that position).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lewis' base salary was lower than the base salary paid to our prior chief financial officer in 2015 to allow time for the compensation committee to assess Mr. Lewis' performance in that position and to provide room for anticipated increases assuming superior performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The base salary of each of the other named executive officers for 2016 remained unchanged from 2015, except for adjustments due to changes in an officer's position within the company or outstanding performance over a period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee otherwise maintained base
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation at levels consistent with 2015 because the committee members believed those base pay levels were reasonable and reflective of our business model and culture, which puts greater emphasis on incentive pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fastenal's performance was not a factor considered by the compensation committee in setting the annual base salaries of our named executive officers for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation committee established the base salary to be paid to each of our named executive officers for 2017 at its last meeting in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee determined the base salary of each of the named executive officers for 2017 would remain unchanged from that in effect at the end of 2016, except that Ms. Lisowski's base salary for 2017 was further increased due to outstanding performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee otherwise maintained base compensation at levels consistent with 2016 because the committee members believed those base pay levels were reasonable and reflective of our business model and culture, which puts greater emphasis on incentive pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Quarterly Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers are eligible for cash incentives through individual bonus arrangements based on improvements in the overall financial performance of the company and/or their respective areas of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bonus arrangements provide our executive officers with the opportunity to earn a cash bonus for each quarter during a year when we increase our earnings above a predetermined minimum target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash bonuses for all of our named executive officers other than our chief financial officer and chief accounting officer are based on growth in pre-tax earnings of the company and/or the officer's area of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee selected pre-tax earnings as the appropriate metric for calculating cash bonuses for those officers because of the committee's belief that the focus of the named executive officers should be on profitability, which is the primary driver of shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash bonuses for our chief financial officer and chief accounting officer are based on growth in company-wide net earnings because the responsibilities of those officers allow them to affect our entire financial position including our tax position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee believes that no named executive officer should earn a cash bonus for a quarter unless financial performance has improved and therefore sets minimum targets for each quarter that are equal to the earnings achieved for the same quarter in the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee requires growth in earnings before any bonuses can be earned due to its belief that growth is achievable with superior effort and will generate the cash necessary to expand the company's operations in accordance with our business plans and increase shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout percentage used to calculate the amount of each named executive officer's quarterly cash bonus reflects the officer's track record in his or her current position (i.e., newly promoted executives historically have had to prove themselves in their new positions before earning higher payout percentages) and relative ability to impact profitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not believe it is necessary for payouts under our executive cash incentive program to be capped, as cash bonus payments to our named executive officers are tied directly to our financial performance so that they increase only if and to the extent the company's profitability grows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not base the cash incentives paid to our executive officers on multiple metrics since we believe the current design of our executive bonus arrangements, along with our other controls, adequately mitigates risk and since the use of multiple metrics would not be in furtherance of our goal of keeping our compensation programs simple, understandable, and transparent, and would risk keeping our executives focused on things other than profitability, thereby depriving them of the clear feedback and motivation necessary to improve our bottom line.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Incentive Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bonus arrangements for our named executive officers for 2016 were approved by our compensation committee at its last meeting in 2015, except that Mr. Florness' bonus arrangement was determined on October 12, 2015 upon his appointment as president and chief executive officer of the company effective January 1, 2016, Mr. Lewis' bonus arrangement was determined on August 4, 2016 upon his appointment as executive vice president and chief financial officer of the company effective August 16, 2016, and Mr. Watts' bonus arrangement was determined by his direct supervisor prior to being named as an executive officer effective December 20, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with prior years, the bonuses for 2016 were based on growth in pre-tax earnings or net earnings of the company and/or the officer's area of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bonuses for each quarter were determined by applying a payout percentage to the amount by which pre-tax earnings or net earnings exceeded 100% of pre-tax earnings or net earnings for the same quarter in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The formula used to determine Mr. Florness' bonuses for 2016 was the same as that used to determine the bonuses of our prior president and chief executive officer in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout percentage used to determine Mr. Lewis' bonuses for 2016 was lower than that used to determine the bonuses of our prior chief financial officer in 2015 to allow time for the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation committee to assess Mr. Lewis' performance in his new position and to provide room for anticipated increases assuming superior performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bonus formulas for each of the other named executive officers for 2016 remained unchanged from 2015, except for adjustments due to changes in an officer's position and changes designed to provide our named executive officers with leadership of our geographic sales areas a stake in company-wide performance as well as the performance of their specific areas of sales leadership, and except that the payout percentage used to determined Ms. Lisowski's bonuses for 2016 was increased due to outstanding performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee otherwise maintained bonus arrangements consistent with 2015 because the committee believed those arrangements were reasonable and reflective of our business model and culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 cash incentive program described above applied to all of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The specific bonus opportunities for our named executive officers are summarized in the table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each named executive officer's cash bonus for each quarter during 2016 was determined by applying the payout percentage listed opposite his or her name below to the amount by which pre-tax earnings or net earnings of the company and/or the officer's area of responsibility for that quarter exceeded 100% of such earnings in the same quarter of 2015 (the 'minimum target').
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name Earnings Type Payout Percentage Mr. Florness Company-wide pre-tax earnings 1.25% Mr. Lewis (1) Company-wide net earnings 0.90% Ms. Lisowski Company-wide net earnings 0.35% Mr. Hein (2) Pre-tax earnings 1.00% / 0.10% Mr. Owen Company-wide pre-tax earnings 0.80% Mr. Watts (3) Pre-tax earnings 2.40% / 0.35%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Mr. Lewis' bonus program was for the period in which he served as executive vice president and chief financial officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) The bonuses for Mr. Hein were based on growth in pre-tax earnings for the geographic area under his leadership (which is the Western United States), with the payout percentage applied to that growth of 1.00%, as well as growth in company pre-tax earnings, with the payout percentage applied to that growth of 0.10%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Incentive Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bonus arrangements for our named executive officers for 2017 were approved by our compensation committee at its last meeting in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with prior years, the bonuses for 2017 will be based on growth in pre-tax earnings or net earnings of the company and/or the officer's area of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bonuses for each quarter will be determined by applying a payout percentage to the amount by which pre-tax earnings or net earnings exceeded 100% of pre-tax earnings or net earnings for the same quarter in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee determined that the bonus formulas for each of the named executive officers for 2017 will remain unchanged from 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consistent with 2016 because the committee believes those arrangements are reasonable and reflective of our business model and culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the incentive plan, our compensation committee has the discretion and authority to reduce, but not increase, the amount of any cash incentive otherwise payable in accordance with the performance objectives established pursuant to the incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We tie a portion of our employee compensation to the market price of Fastenal's common stock by granting stock options pursuant to our stock option plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity-based incentives that can be granted under that plan are limited to stock options in an effort to further our goal of keeping our compensation system simple and easy to understand, and because stock options deliver value to our employees only if our shareholders realize appreciation in the value of their shares held over the same period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to legal restrictions, we are unable to grant options under our stock option plan to certain of our foreign employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, those employees (none of whom are executive officers) are instead eligible to receive stock appreciation rights under a separate plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of those stock appreciation rights are settled in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our employees are eligible to receive equity-based grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When making grants, including to named executive officers, we consider an employee's contribution to the company, including the employee's responsibility for revenues and profits, responsibility for managing others, possession of special skills, and length of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We regularly assess the effectiveness of further expanding the number of persons receiving equity-based grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any expansion will be based on a determination that further employee ownership will result in a deepened employee commitment and likely improvement to overall shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our compensation committee granted stock options to our employees under our stock option plan for a total of 845,440 shares of our common stock with a strike price of $46.00 per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of these grants, options to purchase an aggregate of 240,758 shares were awarded to our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock option grants were made in 2016 to all of our named executive officers (other than Mr. Lewis, who joined the company later in the year) consistent with a change in practice in 2015 pursuant to which most employees with option awards are now receiving yearly grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past, the company generally issued options every five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, commencing in 2015 he company started making grants each year in an effort to provide employees with a more even ladder of opportunity and in order to align he company's practice with that of most other public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock option grants have been made at levels designed to provide recipients with an attractive capital accumulation opportunity should earnings and shareholder values grow at acceptable rates and to facilitate retention of critical employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of the 10,793,660 total shares subject to stock options granted by the company under our stock option plan since April 2007, options covering an aggregate of 2,156,168 shares are either held by, or have been exercised by, our current executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock options granted to executive officers vest and become exercisable over a period of five or eight years from the date of grant, with such staggered vesting designed to ensure continuity of leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically our compensation committee's practice has been to grant stock options in April of each year around the time of our annual shareholders meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with that practice, option grants for 2016 were made on April 19, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Going forward, however, the committee has decided to change its practice by making annual stock option grants at the last meeting of the committee each year effective as of the first trading day of the following year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with that decision, at its last meeting in 2016 the committee granted to our employees, effective January 3, 2017, options to purchase a total of 764,789 shares of our common stock at a strike price of $47.00 per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of those grants, options to purchase an aggregate of 156,808 shares were awarded to our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee decided to shift the annual grant date for two reasons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, the change allowed the committee to grant options to executive officers on the same day the committee established base salary and bonus formulas for those officers, making it easier for the committee to consider the totality of executive compensation in approving each of the components of that compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, since we report financial results on a calendar- year basis, the committee believed that granting options effective at the beginning of a year would allow employees to more easily equate changes in the value of their options to the company's annual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our long-term equity incentive program, we have not established requirements for executive officers to hold specific or minimum levels of investment in company stock, as we believe such a requirement would be contrary to individual and independent personal financial decision making which is part of our entrepreneurial culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We make annual profit-based matching contributions to our executive officers' 401(k) plan accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We allocate the annual profit-based matching contributions made to all employees participating in our 401(k) plan, including our executive officers, based on the same formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers are also entitled to participate in the same health and welfare plans as those made available to our employees generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers do not receive any other perquisites or other personal benefits or property from us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market Competitiveness Review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making executive compensation decisions, both with respect to total compensation and individual elements of compensation, our compensation committee annually reviews executive compensation data for a peer group of companies in order to stay informed of practices and executive pay levels in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, it does not establish specific compensation parameters based on such data, nor does it set the levels of compensation for our executive officers, or individual elements of that compensation, by applying any specific mathematical calculation to peer group compensation data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the decision making process with respect to 2016 executive compensation, our compensation committee reviewed the executive compensation data of a peer group consisting of ten companies (Airgas, Inc., MSC Industrial Direct Co., Inc., W.W. Grainger, Inc., Anixter International, Inc., Applied Industrial Technologies, Inc., Advance Auto Parts, Inc., Genuine Parts Company, The Sherwin-Williams Company, WESCO International, Inc., and Tractor Supply Company).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ten companies were included in our peer group because of their commonalities with our business in that they utilized similar methods of sourcing, distributing, and selling products, and because each had publicly available information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The median revenue of the peer group for 2015 was greater than Fastenal's and the median market capitalization of the peer group as of December 31, 2015 was less than Fastenal's.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The median revenue of the peer group was $6.9 billion (the range of the group was $2.5 billion to $15.3 billion) for 2015, compared to Fastenal's $4.0 billion in 2016 and $3.9 billion in 2015, while the median market capitalization of the peer group was $10.5 billion (the range of the group was $1.6 billion to $24.2 billion) as of December 31, 2015, compared with Fastenal's $13.6 billion on December 31, 2016 and $11.8 billion on December 31, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In comparing Fastenal's executive compensation levels to those of its peer group, the compensation committee looked at base salary, cash incentives, other compensation (which includes stock options, other types of equity compensation, pensions, and perquisites), and total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time the committee made decisions with respect to 2016 executive compensation, the most recent year for which executive compensation data for the peer group was available was 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The base salary of Fastenal's named executive officers in 2016 was lower than the median base salary of the named executive officers of the peer group in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to our weaker financial results in comparison to prior years and our pay for performance philosophy, Fastenal's named executive officers received a nominal amount of cash incentive pay in 2016 (which was a relatively weak year across the entire industry), while the named executive officers of the peer group in 2014 received more significant cash incentive pay in 2014 (when financial results were comparatively stronger across the industry).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total compensation of Fastenal's named executive officers in 2016 was lower than the median total compensation of the named executive officers of the peer group in 2014, due in part to the lower base salary and the nominal cash incentive pay noted above and in part to the lower grant date fair value of the equity compensation awarded to Fastenal's executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the last element, it should be noted the compensation committee does not, in making compensation decisions for the named executive officers, focus on grant date fair value of equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather the committee makes its own internal judgments regarding the value of those awards and has concluded that the opportunity at the company for the creation of long-term stock value, driven by achieving consistent outstanding growth over an extended period of time, is significant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company has historically achieved outstanding growth and the expectation of the committee in granting option awards is that, with superior efforts from our executives and other employees, outstanding growth can resume and continue in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the committee believes the aggregate annual compensation paid to our named executive officers can reasonably be expected to result in significant wealth creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Compensation Review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the decision making process with respect to 2017 executive compensation, our compensation committee reviewed executive compensation data of the same peer group as was used in the preceding year, except that Airgas, Inc., which has ceased to be a public company, was replaced with HD Supply Holdings, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time the committee made decisions with respect to 2017 executive compensation, the most recent year for which executive compensation data for the peer group was available was 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the committee's review of all factors, including peer group compensation, the committee believes the aggregate annual compensation to be paid to our named executive officers can reasonably be expected to result in significant overall wealth creation, and the committee believes our 2017 compensation programs for our named executive officers will be fair, competitive, and sufficient to motivate them to achieve personal success and success for the company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Incentive Recoupment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the compensation committee memorialized its long-standing policy providing that if the company's reported financial results for any period are determined to be incorrect due to material non-compliance with financial reporting requirements and the reported financial results benefited or were detrimental to executive officers participating in cash incentive programs, the compensation committee will, in the case of an underpayment of bonuses, pay those officers the incremental amount due for such period and, in the case of an overpayment of bonuses, reduce cash incentives for those officers in future periods to the extent necessary to enable the company to effectively recover amounts previously paid in error.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If bonuses erroneously paid cannot be effectively recovered by the reduction of future bonuses, then the compensation committee may, at its discretion, reduce other elements of future executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 10D of the Exchange Act directs the SEC to issue rules to require national securities exchanges and national securities associations to list only those companies that implement a policy providing that if the company is required to restate its financial statements due to material non-compliance with financial reporting requirements, the company must recover from current and former executive officers incentive compensation received by them during the three year period preceding the restatement that would not have been paid under the restated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the final rules of the SEC and NASDAQ regarding executive compensation recovery are adopted, we will modify our policy to the extent necessary to fully comply with those rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are mindful of the potential impact upon Fastenal of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code, which prohibits public companies from deducting certain executive remuneration in excess of $1,000,000 annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While reserving our right to offer such compensation arrangements as may from time to time be necessary to attract and retain top-quality management, we intend generally to structure such arrangements, where feasible, so as to minimize or eliminate the impact of the limitations of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No non-deductible compensation was paid to our named executive officers in 2016, and the amount of non-deductible compensation paid to our named executive officers in prior years was minimal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conclusion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation committee believes the combination of base salaries, individual performance based cash incentive arrangements, stock option awards, and other compensation, are fair and reasonable and that the interests of our executive officers are and will remain closely aligned with the long-term interests of Fastenal and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOUSEHOLDING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted a procedure approved by the SEC called 'householding,' by which certain shareholders who do not participate in electronic delivery of proxy materials but who have the same address and appear to be members of the same family receive only one copy of our annual report and proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each shareholder participating in householding continues to receive a separate proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding helps to eliminate duplicative mailings and reduces our mailing and printing expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your household would like to receive individual rather than multiple mailings in the future, please write to Fastenal Company, c/o Broadridge Householding Department, 51 Mercedes Way, Edgewood, New York 11717, or call 1-800-542-1061.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a broker or other nominee holds your shares, you may continue to receive multiple mailings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please contact your broker or other nominee directly to discontinue multiple mailings from them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you currently participate in householding and would prefer to receive separate copies of our 2016 annual report or this proxy statement, please contact us in the manner described above and we will deliver the requested document free of charge and promptly upon receipt of your request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
